short: An investment fund traded on stock exchanges.
full: An Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) is a type of pooled investment security that operates like a mutual fund, but trades on stock exchanges.
example: SPY is an ETF that tracks the S&P 500 index.

short: A payment to shareholders from company profits.
full: Dividends are payments made by a corporation to its shareholder members, typically from profits.
example: Coca-Cola pays quarterly dividends to shareholders.
